skill.name: file-organizer
skill.description: Intelligently organizes your files and folders across your computer by understanding context, finding duplicates, suggesting better structures, and automating cleanup tasks. Reduces cognitive load and keeps your digital workspace tidy without manual effort.
skill.summary: Intelligently organizes your files and folders across your computer by understanding context, findin...
skill.author: ComposioHQ

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and instructions for Claude. No executable code, scripts, or network operations. All operations are standard filesystem commands initiated by user requests.

content.value_statement: Messy folders waste time and create stress. This skill analyzes your files, finds duplicates, and organizes everything into logical structures based on type, purpose, and date.
actual_capabilities: Analyze folder structure and file types across directories
Find duplicate files by hash, name, or size
Suggest logical folder structures based on content
Move and rename files with user approval
Create custom organization schemes by type, date, or purpose
limitations: Requires user confirmation before making any changes
Cannot access files without explicit directory paths from user
Does not delete files without user approval
Cannot organize files on remote servers or network drives

use_cases.title: Tame messy downloads
use_cases.description: Clean up cluttered Downloads folders by sorting files into Documents, Images, and Archives automatically.

use_cases.title: Structure project folders
use_cases.description: Organize project directories and separate active work from archived projects with consistent naming.

use_cases.title: Manage document collections
use_cases.description: Find duplicate documents and organize work files from personal files across Documents folders.

prompt_templates.title: Quick cleanup
prompt_templates.prompt: Organize my Downloads folder. Move documents to Documents, images to Pictures, keep installers separate, and archive files older than 3 months.

prompt_templates.title: Find duplicates
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all duplicate files in my Documents folder and show me which ones to keep and which to remove.

prompt_templates.title: Restructure projects
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my ~/Projects directory and suggest a better structure. Separate active projects from archived ones.

prompt_templates.title: Organize photos
prompt_templates.prompt: Organize all photos in this folder by year and month based on when they were taken.

output: Proposed structure: Work/, Personal/, Installers/, Archive/, ToSort/
Will identify 12 files older than 6 months for archival

best_practices: Start with one messy folder like Downloads to build confidence
Always confirm before deleting anything when prompted
Use consistent naming patterns like YYYY-MM-DD for important files
anti_patterns: Requesting organization of system directories without specifying the path
Skipping the confirmation step and letting changes happen automatically
Asking to delete files without reviewing what will be removed

faq.question: Which operating systems are supported?
faq.answer: Works on macOS, Linux, and Windows with WSL. Uses standard command-line tools available on each platform.

faq.question: How many files can it handle at once?
faq.answer: Performance varies by system. For best results, organize folders with up to a few thousand files at a time.

faq.question: Does it integrate with other tools?
faq.answer: Runs as a Claude skill. Can work alongside file managers and backup tools but does not directly integrate with them.

faq.question: Is my data safe during organization?
faq.answer: All changes require your explicit approval. Files are moved rather than deleted unless you specifically authorize removal.

faq.question: Why is nothing happening when I ask?
faq.answer: Specify the exact folder path you want organized. The skill needs a target directory to begin analysis.

faq.question: How is this different from manual organization?
faq.answer: Uses consistent rules and patterns to categorize files automatically. Suggests logical structures based on file types and content.
